snippet.title: Syringomyelia
snippet.description: * Syringomyelia Syringomyelia is a rare disorder in which a cyst forms within your spinal cord. As the cyst, which is called a syrinx, expands and lengthens over time, it compresses and damages part of your spinal cord from its center outward. Damage to the spinal cord...

snippet.title: Meningomyelocele in Children
snippet.description: * Meningomyelocele in Children The spinal cord and the meninges (the tissue that covers the spinal cord) may actually protrude through the child’s back. In some cases skin covers the spinal cord and meninges, in some cases it sticks through the skin. Spina bifida most commonly occurs...

snippet.title: Spinal Cord Compression
snippet.description: * Spinal Cord Compression What Is Spinal Cord Compression? The spinal cord consists of nerves that send signals or messages back and forth between the brain and the rest of the body. Spinal cord compression occurs when a mass places pressure on the cord. A mass can include a tumor...

snippet.title: Meningocele repair
snippet.description: * Meningocele repair ...children experience a developmental defect, typically during the first trimester, which affects the spinal cord, the fluid-filled sac that surrounds the spinal cord, and sometimes the surrounding nerves. These defects are called "open neural tube" defects....

snippet.title: Friedreich's Ataxia
snippet.description: * Friedreich's Ataxia The disease causes damage to parts of your brain and spinal cord, and can also affect your heart. “Ataxia” is a word with Greek roots, and literally means “lack of order.” There are a number of types of ataxia with a number of causes; Friedreich’s ataxia...

snippet.title: ConsumerReports.org: Muscle Relaxants
snippet.description: * ConsumerReports.org: Muscle Relaxants It arises from conditions affecting the brain and/or spinal cord, such as cerebral palsy, multiple sclerosis, and stroke. Muscle spasms, on the other hand, are usually temporary and are associated with conditions affecting the muscles, bones, and associated...

snippet.title: Sciatica
snippet.description: * Sciatica Sciatica Your sciatic nerve begins at your spinal cord, goes through your hips and buttocks, and then branches down each leg. This nerve is the body’s longest nerve and one of the most important ones, as it has a direct effect on your ability to control...

snippet.title: Congenital Brain Defects
snippet.description: * Congenital Brain Defects It develops into the spinal cord with the brain at the top. If the tube does not close properly, the tissue within the tube can’t develop properly. Several types of congenital brain defects are caused by neural tube defects. They are: Anencephaly: This...

snippet.title: Cervical Spondylosis
snippet.description: * Cervical Spondylosis Herniated disks and bone spurs can put extra pressure on your spinal cord and nerve roots, causing joint pain. The ligaments in your spine, which are strands of tissue that connect your bones, might also become stiffer as you age. This makes it more difficult...
